meta_description: Since its beginnings in 1919, the Woodstock Artists Association and Museum has been committed to exhibiting and collecting work in all media by area artists

About this capture

COLLECTED BY

Organization: [Archive Team](https://archive.org/details/archiveteam)

Formed in 2009, the Archive Team (not to be confused with the archive.org Archive-It Team) is a rogue archivist collective dedicated to saving copies of rapidly dying or deleted websites for the sake of history and digital heritage. The group is 100% composed of volunteers and interested parties, and has expanded into a large amount of related projects for saving online and digital history. 

History is littered with hundreds of conflicts over the future of a community, group, location or business that were "resolved" when one of the parties stepped ahead and destroyed what was there....

[PRINT A MEMBERSHIP FORM](https://www.woodstockart.org/wp-content/uploads/2024/09/MembershipBrochure.pdf)

## BECOME A MEMBER TODAY

Whether you are an artist or art appreciator, you will find the WAAM offers a diverse and dynamic series of programs, events and exhibitions that engage, inspire and educate. Our membership is our most valued asset. You provide meaningful support to the work of the WAAM, which for over 100 years has served as a vital cultural resource in the Hudson Valley/Catskill Region.

[](https://www.woodstockart.org/wp-content/uploads/2025/08/IMG_4451-scaled-copy.webp)

## Levels of Membership

#### ____INDIVIDUAL $125

One annual individual membership (Associate/Active) 

All Members begin as Associate Members.  
[Click here](https://www.woodstockart.org/active-and-associate/) to learn about becoming an Active Member.

#### ____INDIVIDUAL UPGRADED $250

One annual Individual membership, plus:

Eligible for WAAM Viewing Program, offering member artists the opportunity to meet one-on-one with the Executive Director, Gallery Director or Education Cura...
accessibility_text:
**DATES**

Exhibition:   
January 23–March 8, 2026

Opening Reception:   
Saturday, January 24 | 4-6pm

**LOCATION**

Solo Gallery at the WAAM

28 Tinker Street

Woodstock

Categories: [Exhibitions](https://www.woodstockart.org/events/category/exhibitions/)

** _Yura Adams: Marvel’s Cabinet_**

EXHIBITION: January 23–March 8, 2026  
OPENING RECEPTION: Saturday, January 24, 4-6pm  
ARTIST TALK: Saturday, January 24, 3-4pm

SOLO GALLERY

_Marvel’s Cabinet_ presents a body of work by artist Yura Adams that gathers imagined narratives and unlikely companions drawn from the artist’s deep engagement with the natural world. Rooted in close observation, the exhibition transforms encounters with nature into invented forms that blur the boundaries between abstraction, figuration, and storytelling. Works are made using a multitude of materials, including plaster, ceramic, foam, oil and acrylic paint, canvas, mylar, ink, fabric and frequently photography that is buried in the work.

[PRESS RELEASE](https://www.woodstockart.org/wp-content/uploads/2026/01/Yura-Adams_Press-Release.pdf)
